name: Helios Vanguard
history:
In the heart of a bustling intergalactic metropolis, where towering skyscrapers scraped the heavens and neon lights painted the night sky in a kaleidoscope of colors, lived a young woman named Aella Solaris. Aella was no ordinary citizen; she was a skilled mech pilot, trained from childhood to operate the colossal humanoid war machines that served as the backbone of her planet's defense.

From her earliest days, Aella had been fascinated by mechs, their sheer size, power, and the intricate mechanisms that made them hum with life. She spent countless hours in the training simulators, honing her reflexes, strategic thinking, and the ability to synchronize her mind with the mech's advanced artificial intelligence.

Her dedication and talent did not go unnoticed, and at the age of eighteen, Aella graduated from the prestigious Stellar Academy, earning her the coveted title of Helios Vanguard. The Helios Vanguard was no ordinary mech; it was a marvel of engineering, its fusion-powered engines capable of propelling it at incredible speeds, its armor impervious to most attacks, and its weaponry capable of unleashing devastating energy blasts.

Aella felt a deep connection to the Helios Vanguard, their movements becoming one, their thoughts intertwined. She piloted the mech with an almost symbiotic grace, anticipating its every move, reacting to its every signal, and becoming an extension of its formidable power.

With the Helios Vanguard as her steed, Aella embarked on a series of daring missions, her name echoing through the cosmos as a symbol of tactical brilliance and unwavering bravery. She led her squad into countless skirmishes, her strategic brilliance outmaneuvering even the most seasoned commanders. Her mastery of the Helios Vanguard was legendary, its fusion blades slicing through enemy mechs with surgical precision, its particle cannons unleashing devastating salvos that shattered enemy ranks.

systems.flavorDescription: The GMS Companion/Concierge-Class Assistant Unit conforms to all galaxy-wide standards. These virtual assistants pass even the most rigid Turing-Null assessment criteria and are cleared to operate even in the absence of a pilot.

weapon.flavorDescription:
Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-I (T-1) line is defined by powerful, reliable, and conventional-kinetic ranged and melee weapons, including the GMS assault rifle, heavy machine gun, shotgun, pistol, and various light and heavy blades. Reliable galactic standards, the GMS T-1 line is the most widely used mech-scale line of weaponry across the galaxy. Echoing the Everest’s design notes, T-1 weapons are simply designed, with few (if any) moving parts, intended to be used in or adaptable to any environment.

The Type-III (T-3) line is made up of heavy weapons, ordnance, and other exotic, specialized, or massive weapons. A broad classification, the T-3 range includes conventional-kinetic anti-materiel rifles, super-rapid cycling pulse rifles, missile racks, cannons, and drone nexuses – “hive” style launchers that serve as miniature factory, hangar, and deployment systems for portable drones. The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.
